Oliver Llinares, F
Idígoras Ayastuy, G
de Benito Basanta, L
Torres Piedra, C
Bezanilla Regato, J L
metadata.dc:description: Bilaterality is uncommon in Wilms' tumor, being present in 4% to 8% of the cases. Definite progress has been made in the treatment with marked improvement in prognosis. The recent trend toward more conservative sugery, preoperative chemotherapy an avoidance of high-dose radiation therapy has yielded good results. This is confirmed in our two cases with synchronous tumors.
metadata.dc:title: Tumor de Wilms bilateral sincrónico.
[Simultaneous bilateral Wilms tumor].
